adjective.description: Of or relating to the family Polemoniaceae of chiefly herbaceous plants native to Europe, Asia, and America (including phlox and gilia), the type genus of which is Polemonium.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Robert Mayne (1808–1868). From Polemonium + -aceous, after scientific Latin Polemoniaceae, family name (J. Lindley Synopsis Brit. Flora 168, replacing earlier Polemonia (A. L. Jussieu Genera plantarum 136), Poleminidae).
